abstract: Former News International chairman Les Hinton testifies in parliamentary committee addressing phone hacking scandal; denies any wrongdoing and says phone hacking was restricted to single reporter Clive Goodman, who was jailed for the practice in 2007.
snippet: Les Hinton, testifying to a parliamentary committee in London, dismissed talk of widespread phone hacking at The News of the World as mere accusations.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

lead_paragraph: Les Hinton, testifying to a parliamentary committee in London, dismissed talk of widespread phone hacking at The News of the World as mere accusations.

headline.main: In Phone Hacking Inquiry, a Renewed Focus on Executives
headline.print_headline: In Phone Hacking Inquiry, a Renewed Focus on Executives
